text: that's a really good point about energy! Generating but also storing it effectively so that it can be transported could be a game changer!
I think in terms of your own skills, you are still young and you have a long journey of learning ahead of you - it's great that you are already curious about these things, coding your own stuff etc.
I think in general one thing I wish I had done more is spend time, when I had it, to learn some of the fundamentals e.g. mathematics

or during the early years of university, some of the computer science fundamentals! of course, it's never too late to learn and it turned out fine for me, but I think as I grew up I gained a renewed appreciation for those things! :slightly_smiling_face:

you may read lots of articles, especially about software developers, claiming that we are a special kind of worker, or you may see developers portrayed as these geniuses on TV etc. but ultimately it's going to be hard work that will set you apart! I know, it sounds cliche.
But just like you need to practice a natural language, like English, in order to get better at it, it's no different for programming
but that is what makes it wonderful and exciting! I'm learning every day!
another mistake I've made in the past is that I was too scared to appear silly: I would act as if I know things, or act as if I understand things, even when I didn't
I think if I could there are certain situations when I wouldn't have done that anymore, and try to learn as much as I can from the people around me!

but all this is a bit theoretical. To answer the question "how can I improve", in practice: I think choose projects that you enjoy, go through the process of making them achievable, and try to take them from beginning to end. Wrapping up a project is often more difficult than it is to start a project.

what aspect of software do you find most interesting these days? Websites? Apps? Making your own games? Artificial intelligence? Something else? Based on that I could give you some resources to get started!
I'd also love to hear more about the RPG you started making :smile:

I'm not really interested in Website making all that much but I think I will end up learning it out of interest. I think the more useful an app is to the real world or how important an app is, the more interested I would be.
 I think AI is something that will do very well in the future, I don't think it will explode this decade, I'll constantly look out for anything interesting about it but I'm not too sure about going into that industry.
I love making little details in programs which is why I started that RPG, I wanted to design a game that had a good world to it. For that, I even made a word document where I explained all the races and their cultures. I then made a table of purchasable weapons the player could buy  with durability, damage, cost, selling cost and minimum level to wield it. It's set in a middle earth like world where they use weapons that were used before gunpowder was an aspect in warfare. It's definitely something that will take a long amount of time and commitment.
